document.masterDocTitle: Haasea Verhoeff, 1895 - a genus of tumultuous history and chaotic recordsredefinition, revision of taxonomy and geographic distributions, with descriptions of two new species from Austria and Serbia (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida, Haaseidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Haasea Verhoeff, 1895 - a genus of tumultuous history and chaotic recordsredefinition, revision of taxonomy and geographic distributions, with descriptions of two new species from Austria and Serbia (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida, Haaseidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Verhoeff, K. W.
bibRefCitation.refString: Verhoeff, K. W. (1901) Beitrage zur Kenntniss palaearktischer Myriopoden. XVIII. Aufsatz: Uber Diplopoden aus Suddeutschland und Tirol. Jahreshefte des Vereins fur vaterlandische Naturkunde in Wurttemberg, 57, 81 - 111.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
H. germanica
differs from congeners by some gonopodal structures, viz., 1) absence of anterior lateral process (vs. developed in
H. cyanopida
,
H. lacusnigri
,
H. intermedia
,
H. microcorna
,
H. makarovi
sp. nov.
, and
H. plasana
), 2) absence of the distal notch of the posterior lamella (vs. presence in
H. flavescens
and
H. hungarica
), 3) mesal process saw-like, strongly denticulated (vs. mesal process knife-like with posterobasal tooth in
H. vidinensis
or with denticulated anterodistal lobe in
H. fonticulorum
), 4) posterior lamella simple, ear-shaped, bent down in an extensions and with distolateral thickening (vs. posterior lamella rounded, not bent down into an extension and without distolateral thickening in
H. pretneri
and
H. musimontium
or posterior lamella bilobed in
H. filicis
, H. fau- cium ,
H. inflata
and
H. gruberi
sp. nov.
).

Type material examined:
NHMW: Lectotype : 1 ♂ , Böhmerwald , Verhoeff det., leg. don. here designated ( NHMW9826 ). Paralectotypes : 1 ♂ , 3 ♀♀ , 2 juveniles , same data as lectotype ( NHMW2127 ). ZMB: Paralecto- types: ZMB3283: 1 male , 2 females [Böhmerwald]; ZMB2328 1 male , 1 female [Bayrisch. Wald]; Verhoeff slides ZMB12736 : a: posterior gonopods, lp 10, lp7? [Ludwigsthal], b : anterior gonopods, posterior gonopods, lp 10, lp 11 [Ludwigsthal]; ZMB12768 : a : posterior gonopods, anterior gonopods, lp 10 [Arbersee]; b : anterior gonopods, posterior gonopods, lp 10, lp 7 [Arbersee]; c : anterior gonopods, posterior gonopods, lp 7, lp 10 [Ludwisgsthal]; d : anterior gonopods [Ludwigsthal]; e : anterior gonopods, posterior gonopods, lp 7 l 10, lp 11, ring 7 [Arbersee]
.

Distribution ( Figs 38 , 40 ). Austria : Lower Austria : near Zwettl ( Gruber 2014 ; present study); numerous localities in Waldviertel region; Waidhofen an der Ybbs; Oismühle; Hainbuch; St. Valentin; Schweinbergbach; Ardagger; Freyenstein; Blindenmarkt; Säusenstein; Krummnussbaum; Wachau (present study); Upper Austria : Mauthausen; Klamschlucht; Hammergraben (Küpfern); Weyer; Steyr; Kremsmauer; Oberlaussa; Almkogelgipfel (present study); Styria : Ennstal, Admont; Pleschberg, Admont; Leichenberg; (present study). Czech Republic : Horní Jiřetín; Loučná; Cínovec (Dubi); Plešivec ( Lang 1967 , with question marks); Horská Kvilda ( Lang 1971 , with question mark); Gry- bla u Krhanic; Vlčí rokle u Prosečnice (Kocourek 2018); Ledný potok, Dobřív; Kotelské louky; Třemšínská bouda ( Kocourek & Tajovský 2018 ); Špičák; V Klučí; Velký Špičák ( Tajovský 2017b ). All of the following localities are published within the map in
Kocourek et al. (2017)
(for details see Schubart (1934) ; Kocourek (2014) ; Kocourek & Tajovský (2011) ; Tajovský (1993 , 2001 ): Kubova Huť; Bučina; Rychnov nad Kněžnou; Jablonec nad Nisou; Chelčice; Ještěd; Křivoklát; Železná Ruda; Loučná (Most); Loučovice; Ferdinandov; Mladá Boleslav; Bílý Potok; Nová Pec; Troskovice; Javorník; Světlá pod Ještědem; Roztoky; Černé Údolí; Mysliboř; Horní Lomná; Rožnov pod Radhoštěm; Hrubá Skála; Rejštejn; Čerchov; Chomutov. Germany : Hof (Saale); Köditz ( Verhoeff 1917 ); Zwiesel; Grafenau; Passau ( Schubart 1934 ); Krottensee (Neuhaus an der Pegnitz) ( Dobat 1978 ); Oberfranken ( Hartmann & Scheidler 1988 ); Sächsische Schweiz ( Hauser & Voigtländer 2008 ); Plauen (present study); All of the following localities are published within the map in Hauser & Voigtländer (2019) (for details see
Reip et al. 2012
): Hinterhermsdorf (Kirnitzschtal); Falkenbach (Freyung); Röhrnbach-Kumreut; Ruhla, Kittelsthal; Garsitz (Königsee); Suhl, Schleusingen; Zella-Mehlis; Eisenach; Oberhof; Lam; Frauenau; Zwieslerwaldhaus (Lindberg); Seebachschleife (Bayerisch Eisenstein); Wiesau; Ludwigsthal; Arbersee; Neideck-Muggendorf; Fränkische Höhlen; Maximilians-Grotte; Pfaffenhofen a.d. Ilm; Garmisch-Partenkirchen; Deggendorf; Cham. Romania : near Baia Mare? ( Ceuca 1979 ).

Comments. One of the two males in Latzel’s type series of
Craspedosoma flavescens
housed in NHMW (see
Wirkner et al. 2002: 13
) is
H. germanica .

None of the gonopod structures mounted in the slide preparations from ZMB collection corresponded to the drawings of the original description of the species thus our choice of lectotype from the well preserved and complete type specimens housed in NHMW.

Attems (1949: 129 ; 1954: 311) misidentified two males from Kremsmauer, two males and two females from Almkogelgipfel, one male from Oberlaussa, four males, 2 females and one juvenile from Pleschberg and one male from Ennstal, Admont as
Orobainosoma flavescens
. Also, there are two vials with Attems’s wrong identification from Leichenberg, Admont (
O. flavescens
) and Jauerling (
O. flavescens pinivagum
); those are probably never published.

Records of
H. germanica
in Czech Republic from Lang (1967 , 1971 ) should be taken with reserve, since it is possible that these are misidentifications (Dolejš, pers. comm.). The record of
H. germanica
from Romania ( Ceuca 1979 ) is quite remote, completely outside the distribution area of the species and should be considered with caution. These localities are marked in the map with question marks.
